title: Klavže
text:
Klavže () is a settlement in the <a href="Ba%C4%8Da%20%28river%29">Bača</a> Valley in the <a href="Municipality%20of%20Tolmin">Municipality of Tolmin</a> in the <a href="Slovenian%20Littoral">Littoral</a> region of <a href="Slovenia">Slovenia</a>.
Name.
Klavže was attested in written sources in 1763–87 as "Klausa". The name is derived from the Slovene common noun "klavže" 'logging sluice' (< German "Klause" < <a href="Middle%20High%20German">Middle High German</a> "klûse" < Medieval Latin "clūsa" 'barrier'), referring to logging activity in the area.
Infrastructure.
The <a href="Bohinj%20Railway">Bohinj Railway</a> line runs through the settlement. The Podmelec Hydroelectric Plant was built at Klavže in 1931 by Luigi Corvi.
